text: Bottle from beermerchants. Dark gold color. Medium white head. Medium sweetness and bitterness. Body is medium and smooth. Aroma is fruity, nutty, light chocolate, caramel. Flavour is caramel, spices and hops!

Piana dość obfita, drobna i średnia, utrzymuje się w postaci mięsistej chmurki. Barwa bursztynowa, mętna. W aromacie przyjemny karmel połączony z kandyzowanymi owocami i jasnym, dojrzałym winogronem, delikatne zioła. W smaku półwytrawne, choć posmak wydaje się słodki, w typie syropu klonowego, akacji, cukru kandyzowanego. Goryczka niska, ziołowo pikantna, głogowy aftertejs, niewielkie wysycenie, bardzo pijalne i lekkie (nie wodniste) w odbiorze.

Ciekawe piwo, brytyjska alternatywa dla amerykańskich APA czy niemieckich pilsów Fajne.

29th July 2016Hazy amber beer, good cream colour head. Palate is light and semi dry, modest fine carbonation. Light malts, nice caramel, and modest creamy sweetness. Tangy dried fruits. Touches of sweet floralness and marmalade. Light finish brings a pretty mild bitterness. There is a definite olde worlde feel and charm about this beer. Very drinkable.

33cl bottle from the brewery tap room. It pours a clean orange Amber color with a minimal beige head. Aroma is sweet fruity malty with notes of biscuit, malts, dry fruits, light musty notes. Taste is also sweet and malty with more notes of biscuit, bread dough, dried fruits, crackers, light grainy dry finish. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, average

Bottle at Parch, 02/07/16.
Rich amber with a decent off white head.
Nose is caramel, toffee, biscuit, nutty, brown bread.
Taste comprises biscuit malt, pinch of pipe tobacco, Champagne yeast, candied nuts, toffee, brown bread, light spice, airy malts.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Tasty high boost mild.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle at home in London - picked up at the brewery. Pours totally clear orange-gold, lightly effervescent, with a thick, frothy off-white head; looks excellent. Theres a bit of English yeast in the nose, some bready malts, light toffee, subtle toasted honey, a whisper of citrus. Medium sweet flavour with rather delicious creamy toffee character, mellow bitter toasted hay, biscuits, faint leaves, some sun-kissed pale malts. Light bodied with rich, massaging carbonation that echoes nicely the creaminess in the flavour. Well balanced on the finsh, with further pronounced bready malt character, nips of butterscotch and toffee, soft bitterness, a dash of vanilla. Well, this is some delicious stuff. Supremely well balanced, and massively drinkable.

Bottle from the brewery and drunk at home. Russet colour, hazy. Lasting cream head. Its got some lovely caramel and biscuit flavour. Will some rather good malty fruit as well. Lovely mouthfeel. Wow, I have to say that is lovely. I could drink that all day. I love the malty biscuit. Delicious.

Cask at Cask Pub and Kitchen, Pimlico, London. A hazy dark golden/amber coloured pour with a medium white head on top. Sweet, malty, caramel aroma. Tastes similar, quite rich, malty, caramel, fruity, slightly bitter with a hint of sweetness in there too. Decent beer but the score would have been much higher if wasnt served so warm. CPK should know better.

Grain and cereal malts, caramel, bread malts, light straw, citrus fruits, sweet orange. Slightly hazy, dark gold, small, creamy, off-white head. Light sweet. Sweet malts, bread, caramel, sweet citrus fruits, orange, lemon, light floral bitterness coming up in the lightly dry finish. Exceptionally nice Mild, very powerful and rich aroma and palate, yet I preferred the non-dry-hopped version. Cask CASK Pub & Kitchen, Pimlico. Earlier Rating: 5/29/2016 Total Score: 4.1Intense grain and cereal malts, caramel, biscuit, bread malts, light straw. Slightly hazy, dark gold, small, creamy, off-white head. Light sweet. Sweet malts, bread, caramel, sweet citrus fruits, orange, light floral bitterness coming up in the lightly dry finish. Exceptionally nice Mild, very powerful and rich aroma and palate. Cask CASK Pub & Kitchen, Pimlico.

Cask at CP&K. It pours hazy deep amber with a medium off-white head. The aroma is rich malty action, bitter - sweet, pine, sweet florals, fruit cake, earth, leather and spice. The taste is bitter, earthy, wood, leather, spice, floral notes, brown bread, light varnish, pepper, grass, candied orange peel and a hint of alcohol with a lingering dry, peppery finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. As with the other version of this there is just so much depth for the style. Rich and interesting. A joy to drink.Earlier Rating: 5/29/2016 Total Score: 4.1Cask at CP&K. It pours hazy amber with a medium off-white head. The aroma is rich, malt - driven, leather, brown bread, fruit cake, candied peel, spice, earth and wood. The taste is rich, bitter, earth, musty brown bread, dirt, spice, old leather sofa, dried fruits, fruit cake, alcohol and dull orange peel with a lingering dry finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. Great depth of flavour to it. Rich and earthy. I really like this stuff. Reminds me of something Luckie Ales would do (thats a big compliment).
